item.description:
Why bother learning objective C when you can develop apps for the iPhone/iPad/Droid using what you already know - jQuery and PHP. The result is so realistic, users won't distinguish the difference.

Announcing jQuery Mobile:
jQuery Mobile is a unified user interface system across all popular mobile device platforms, built on the rock-solid jQuery and jQuery UI foundation. Its lightweight code is built with progressive enhancement, and has a flexible, easily themeable design. Join us for an expert presentation and overview from my good friends at the Filament Group. They wrote the book on Progressive Enhancement, they contribute to the jQuery UI Project, and now they are part of the newly released jQuery Mobile project.

BoothCamp (6-7pm):

In addition to the main topic, you can join us during the Social Hour from 6-7 for BoothCamp and a presentation on: Create professional looking buttons with CSS3 Join Jen Strickland as she will show you a great solution to make your buttons and links look and feel very professional - all with CSS. Whatever you do, don't waste time creating images as buttons and links. These solution use CSS and allows you to easily implement design and terminology changes in your sites. It's not too hard to do,but once implemented, you will love the results. Jen will show and demonstrate most of these solutions and then show you some of the better ones with live working code so everyone can follow along.

  • Review and demo of leading CSS button solutions
  • Live coding example adding CSS buttons to a site
  • Discussion and your questions

Agenda: 
6:00 - 6:45 : Boothcamp, CSS3 Buttons 
6:35 - 7:00 : Announcements 
7:00 - 8:45 : jQuery Mobile presentation 
9:00 - ???? : Beers somewhere?
item.name: jQuery Mobile: How to develop mobile apps.
